summary:
I’m a passionate business leader with a reputation for sales performance, innovative thinking, strong commercial acumen and a loyal network of customers, suppliers and peers. My leadership style is that of a light touch for high outcomes, honed through many years of delivering through 3rd party intermediaries.
My business skills were forged in an international bank, working with terminal or near-terminal businesses to shut down or manage them back to profitability.
I’ve been involved in the Australian arms of two ‘start-ups” and for four and a half years I ran my own fleet consultancy business. I also incubated seven start-up franchisees in a finance based start-up franchisor.
In 2015 I conceptualised OviDrive. Artificial Intelligence had become mainstream, OBD technologies became cheaper and dependable, and software-as-a-service substantially dropped the cost to maintain an ERP system. This confluence sparked OviDrive, the only platform in the world that uses real-time data, machine learning and AI to automate vehicle and fleet management. 
Recognising early that Sustainability and Mobility- As-a-Service would change the fleet landscape we pre-positioned as a supply-side enabler. I’m now taking a more vocal role in the future of business mobility. I am a firm believer that congestion and pollution can be curtailed through advanced logistics and utilisation management. Having worked in small businesses through to large corporates, I have a deep understanding of the time constraints we all have, and token gestures are simply no longer enough -systems need to act on our behalf! I’m proud to have been instrumental in the delivery of a system that will remove unnecessary vehicles from the roads, have a positive environmental impact and actively influence businesses toward efficient mobility practices.

awards.title: Status of Scholar
awards.issuer: University Of Western Australia - Kingswood College

profile_positions.description:
OviDrive®™ is the ultimate SaaS vehicle control system:

It takes any size fleet beyond traditional automation, using real time data and machine learning capabilities to deliver a fully integrated & infinitely scalable service
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Connecting WA businesses with Australia's only owned, operated and self funded fleet leasing and management company. Fleetpartners' product suite includes operating, finance and novated leasing.

FleetPartners provides the opportunity for organisations to outsource part or all of their fleet management activities so that their people can focus on core business operations.  Benefits of this approach include:
Capital release – capital tied up in depreciating assets can be released and reinvested into core business projects.  Moving assets to an operating lease under a Sale and Leaseback program frees up your balance sheet and can improve your debt to equity ratio

Administrative savings are achieved by freeing up your personnel to focus on their specialty, your core business activities.  Hassle-free fleet outsourcing is our specialty, so we take care of your fleet whilst you take care of your business

Risk elimination is achieved through an operating lease, relieving you of exposure to fluctuating used asset values.  A Fully Maintained lease allows you also to avoid the cost of unexpected maintenance and repairs

Smooth cashflows and fixed budgeted costs are also achieved through fully maintained operating leases, perfect for fixed term contracts or to simply align to your business’s revenue cashflows

Your business’s credit lines are preserved via an operating lease facility leaving them free for other business investments

A substantial buying power advantage is accessed through our strong partnerships with national suppliers.  We focus on ensuring your vehicle is specified correctly and purchased competitively, whilst you remain focussed on your core business

Driver support is provided 24/7/365 to improve employee productivity and reduce frustration and escalation of concerns.  Drivers are support both via telephone and email hotlines
profile_positions.title: Business Development

profile_positions.description:
Director and part owner of Easifleet, managing  sales and customer service delivery in the managed operating lease business stream.

Since 1992 Easifleet has been a Western Australian owned and operated fleet management and leasing business.

Not only do we guarantee to beat any genuine novated lease quote, with all of our operational services being handled in-house we guarantee un-paralleled service delivery across all of our products packaged with extremely competitive pricing.

National scale and reach- but small enough to deliver a flexible tailored solution.
profile_positions.title: Director | General Manager Leasing

profile_positions.description:
Fleetpartners provides vehicle mobility solutions using a strategic framework establishing a customer centric value proposition.
Accountabilities include:
Implementation and periodic review of customer strategy,  using strategic account management techniques to assess implementation success.
Identify third party distribution channels, and develop existing channel sales growth.
Build and implement both national and regional sales and marketing plans. 
Motivate and lead the teams, both national and regional,  to meet strategic objectives
Training and development of the team
profile_positions.title: Channel Strategic Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Business Development for commercial customers, in both chattel and commercial property
Lead the WA office for an international leasing business
Customer needs analysis and recommendations
Corporate customer strategy development, implementation, and periodic review
Customer application collection, submission and monitoring
profile_positions.title: Fleet & Leasing Consultant./ Finance Broker

profile_positions.description:
Assist Franchisees with the development of sales and marketing strategies, including staff development.
Facilitate workshops to train new home loan writers.
Attend interviews with loan writers to provide coaching as required.
Manage the loan processing centre including tracking loan applications from submission through to settlement.
Assist with customer enquiries from a regional perspective (usually customer concerns, variations or increases).
Maintain operational efficiency and compliance of Franchisees.
profile_positions.title: Franchise Business Manager

profile_positions.description:
Preparation and Implementation of Business  and marketing plans for the growth of the Western Australian region. 
Prepare budgets, and manage costs to ensure operational targets are met for the region.
Identification and Development of New Business Opportunities, including tender preparation.
Manage the existing portfolio of clients for the Western Australian region comprising of medium size to corporate entities.
Prepare and present proposals based on solutions developed to respond to needs identified, and to be satisfied, higher up the supply value chain. This results in partnership forging and a lessening of the relevance of price.
Manage and monitor facility credit limits through the interpretation of historical and projected financial information.
Identify, then build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including third parties, ensuring maximisation of future business opportunities. This includes matrix relationship development to minimise exposure to the loss of key personnel.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Manage, motivate, support, develop, and train the SA &WA Sales/ Client Services, and the Victorian Client Service Team, including Business Development Managers, Client Services Managers and their support staff. Development was targeted for areas such as relationship building, solution selling and general business acumen. 
Build the regional portfolio of operating leasing and management clients within Victoria and South Australia.
Build and maintain relationships at both operational and executive level with clients, suppliers, and appropriate third parties.
Identification and development of new business opportunities.
Prepare and present proposals based on solutions developed to respond to needs identified, and to be satisfied, higher up the supply value chain. This results in partnership forging and a lessening of the relevance of price.
Manage and monitor facility credit limits through the interpretation of historical and projected financial information.
profile_positions.title: Senior Client Services Manager
